Package stacks

Class BrowserNavigation

java.lang.Object
stacks.BrowserNavigation
public class BrowserNavigation extends Object
Simulates a browser's back and forward buttons by recording links that are visited and then keeping a stack of "back" links and a stack of "forward" links.
Author:
Foothill College, Bita M, Jason Palmeri

  • Method Details

    • getNavigationFeature

      protected Navigator getNavigationFeature()
      Accessor method to the navigation feature.
      Returns:
      an object that enables the navigating the available links.

    • search

      public boolean search(String linkName)
      Search both back links and forward links to see if we can find the link of interest.
      Parameters:
      linkName - The link to search in the backLinks and forwardLinks.

    • printLinks

      public void printLinks(String message)
      Print both back and forward links.
      Parameters:
      message - Additional details about the current set of links to be printed.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Creates an object of type BrowserNavigation which contains two StackList objects: one stack for back links and another stack for forward links. Scans a plain text file to determine which links is the current link and whether to go forward or backward. Also, search to determine whether a given link is the current link or lies in the forward/back collections.
